summary:
25. The Security Council expresses concern about conflict-related sexual violence in Somalia, calls on parties to cease such violations, and requests the Secretary-General to implement relevant provisions of previous resolutions, including strengthening women's protection.

26. The Council demands parties ensure safety and security of humanitarian personnel and supplies, and ensure full, safe, and unhindered access for humanitarian aid.

27. The Secretary-General is requested to redouble efforts to coordinate UN activities in Somalia, provide good offices and political support, and mobilize resources for recovery and development.

28. The Council requests strengthened cooperation among IGAD, the African Union, and the UN to reduce duplication and ensure proper resource utilization.

29. The Secretary-General is requested to report on all aspects of this resolution every four months.

30. The Security Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
